translated: Now, therefore, we shall expound the Dharma, which is the means of attaining prosperity and the highest good.

analyzed: yatas bhyudaya niḥśreyasa siddhiḥ sa dharmaḥ
translated: That from which the attainment of prosperity and the highest good arises is Dharma.
The authority of the scriptures is due to the statements of such persons.

original: dharmaviśeṣa prasūtāt dravyaguṇakarmasāmānya viśeṣasamavāyānāṃ padārthānāṃ sādharmyavaidharmyābhyāṃ tattvajñānānniḥśreyasam / / / /
analyzed: dharma viśeṣa prasūtāt dravya guṇa karma sāmānya viśeṣa samavāyānām padārthānām sādharmya vaidharmyābhyām tattva jñānāt niḥśreyasam  /
translated: From the specific Dharma, by the knowledge of the truth of substances, qualities, actions, universals, particulars, and inherence through their similarities and dissimilarities, there is the highest good.

original: pṛthivyāpastejo vāyurākāśaṃ kālo digātmā mana iti dravyāṇi / / / /
analyzed: pṛthivī apaḥ tejaḥ vāyuḥ ākāśam kālaḥ diś ātmā manaḥ iti dravyāṇi
translated: Earth, water, fire, air, space, time, direction, self, mind - these are substances.

original: ruparasagandhasparśāḥ saṃkhyāḥ parimāṇāni pṛthaktvaṃ saṃyogavibhāgau paratvāparatve buddhayaḥ sukhaduḥkhe icchādveṣau prayatnāśca guṇāḥ / / /
analyzed: saṃkhyāḥ parimāṇāni pṛthaktvam saṃyoga vibhāgau paratva aparatve buddhayaḥ sukha duḥkhe icchā dveṣau prayatnāḥ ca guṇāḥ
translated: Color, taste, smell, touch, number, measure, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, priority, posteriority, cognition, pleasure, pain, desire, aversion, and effort are qualities.

original: utkṣepaṇamavakṣepaṇaṃ ākuñcanaṃ prasāraṇaṃ gamanamiti karmāṇi / / / /🔽sadanityaṃ dravyavat kāryaṃ kāraṇaṃ sāmānyaviśeṣavaditi dravyaguṇakarmaṇāmaviśeṣaḥ / / / /
analyzed: utkṣepaṇam avakṣepaṇam ākuñcanam prasāraṇam gamanam iti karmāṇi  sat anityam dravyavat kāryam kāraṇam sāmānya viśeṣa vat iti dravya guṇa karmaṇām aviśeṣaḥ
translated: Upward movement, downward movement, contraction, expansion, and motion are actions.🔽Being, permanence, possessing substance, effect, cause, having universals and particulars - these are the similarities between substances, qualities, and actions.

analyzed: dravya guṇayoḥ sajātīya ārambhaka tvam sādharmyam
translated: The similarity between substances and qualities is that they are producers of their own kind.

analyzed: dravyāṇi dravya antaram ārabhante guṇāḥ ca guṇa antaram
translated: Substances produce another substance, qualities produce another quality.
Action does not have an action as its effect.
A substance is not the cause of another substance.
Qualities are both.
Action is opposed to the effect.

analyzed: kriyā guṇavat samavāyi kāraṇam iti dravya lakṣaṇam
translated: The definition of substance is: that which has action and qualities and is the inherent cause.

analyzed: dravya āśrayya guṇavān saṃyoga vibhāgeṣu akāraṇam anapekṣaḥ iti guṇa lakṣaṇam
translated: The definition of quality is: that which inheres in a substance, is devoid of qualities, is not a cause of conjunction and disjunction, and is independent.

analyzed: eka dravyam aguṇam saṃyoga vibhāgeṣu anapekṣa kāraṇam iti karma lakṣaṇam
translated: The definition of action is: that which inheres in one substance, is devoid of qualities, and is the independent cause of conjunction and disjunction.

analyzed: dravya guṇa karmaṇām dravyam kāraṇam sāmānyam
translated: Substance is the general cause of substances, qualities, and actions.
Similarly, quality is the general cause of qualities.
Action is the general cause of conjunction, disjunction, and velocity.
Action is not the cause of substances.
Because of the difference.
Substance is the general effect of substances.
Action is not the effect of action because of the dissimilarity of qualities.

analyzed: dvi tva prabhṛtayaḥ saṃkhyāḥ pṛthak tva saṃyoga vibhāgāḥ ca
translated: Duality and other numbers, separateness, conjunction, and disjunction.

analyzed: asamavāyāt sāmānya kāryam karma na vidyate  /
translated: Action is not the effect of the universal because of non-inherence.
The substance of conjunctions...
The form of forms...
The upward motion of heaviness, effort, and conjunctions...
The conjunctions and disjunctions of actions...

analyzed: kāraṇa sāmānye dravya karmaṇām karma akāraṇam uktam
translated: The action of substances and actions in the general cause has been stated...
The absence of an effect is due to the absence of a cause...

analyzed: na tu kārya abhāvāt kāraṇa abhāvaḥ
translated: But the absence of a cause is not due to the absence of an effect...
The distinction between universal and particular depends on the cognition...

analyzed: bhāvaḥ nuvṛtteḥ eva hetu tvāt sāmānyam eva
translated: Existence is only a universal because it is the cause of the continuous occurrence...

original: dravyatvaṃ guṇatvaṃ karmatvaṃ ca sāmānyāni viśeṣāśca / / / /
analyzed: dravya tvam guṇa tvam karma tvam ca sāmānyāni viśeṣāḥ ca
translated: Substance-ness, quality-ness, and action-ness are universals and particulars...
Except for the last particulars...

original: saditi yato dravyaguṇakarmasu sā sattā / / / /🔽dravyaguṇakarmabhyor'thāntaraṃ sattā / / / /
analyzed: sat iti yatas dravya guṇa karmasu sā sattā  dravya guṇa karmabhyaḥ ṛtha antaram sattā
translated: The existence that is in substances, qualities, and actions is existence...🔽Existence is different from substances, qualities, and actions...

original: guṇakarmasu ca bhāvānna karma na guṇaḥ / / / /
analyzed: guṇa karmasu ca bhāvāt na karma na guṇaḥ
translated: And because it exists in qualities and actions, it is neither an action nor a quality...
And because of the absence of universals and particulars...

analyzed: aneka dravyavat tvena dravya tvam uktam  /
translated: Substance-ness is stated to be the quality of having many substances...
And because of the absence of universals and particulars...

analyzed: tathā guṇeṣu bhāvāt guṇa tvam uktam
translated: Similarly, quality-ness is stated because it exists in qualities...
And because of the absence of universals and particulars...
Action is said to be due to the existence of action in the objects.
And due to the absence of general and specific characteristics.

analyzed: sat iti liṅga aviśeṣāt viśeṣa liṅga abhāvāt ca ekaḥ bhāvaḥ  rūpa rasa gandha sparśavatī pṛthivī
translated: The existence is said to be one due to the non-distinction of gender and the absence of specific gender.🔽Earth is endowed with form, taste, smell and touch.

analyzed: rūpa rasa sparśavatyaḥ āpaḥ dravāḥ snigdhāḥ  tejaḥ rūpa sparśavat
translated: Water is endowed with form, taste and touch, and is fluid and cohesive.🔽Fire is endowed with form and touch.
Air is endowed with touch.

original: ta ākāśe na vidyante / / / /🔽sarpirjatumadhūcchiṣṭānāṃ agnisaṃyogāddravatvamadbhiḥ sāmānyam / / / /
analyzed: te ākāśe na vidyante  / sarpiḥ jatu madhūcchiṣṭānām agni saṃyogāt drava tvam adbhiḥ sāmānyam
translated: They do not exist in space.🔽The fluidity of ghee, lac and wax due to contact with fire is common with water.

analyzed: trapu sīsa loha rajata suvarṇānām agni saṃyogāt drava tvam adbhiḥ sāmānyam
translated: The fluidity of tin, lead, iron, silver and gold due to contact with fire is common with water.

original: viṣāṇī kakudmān prāntevāladhiḥ sāsnāvān iti gotve dṛṣṭaṃ liṅgam / / / /
analyzed: viṣāṇī kakudmān prāntevāladhiḥ sāsnāvān iti go tve dṛṣṭam liṅgam  /
translated: The horns, dewlap, tail and hump are seen as characteristics of the cow in the cow.
And touch is of air.

original: na ca dṛṣṭānāṃ sparśa ityadṛṣṭaliṅgo vāyuḥ / / / /
analyzed: na ca dṛṣṭānām sparśaḥ iti adṛṣṭa liṅgaḥ vāyuḥ
translated: And since touch is not seen, air is inferred from the unseen characteristic.
It is a substance due to not having the nature of a non-substance.
It is a quality due to having action and having qualities.
Eternality is said due to not having the nature of a substance.
The combination of air with air is the characteristic of plurality.

original: vāyusannikarṣe pratyakṣābhāvāt dṛṣṭaṃ liṅgaṃ na vidyate / / / /
analyzed: vāyu sannikarṣe pratyakṣa abhāvāt dṛṣṭam liṅgam na vidyate  /
translated: Because there is no perception in the contact with air, there is no seen inferential mark.
And there is no distinction from the seen in general.
Therefore, it is based on scripture.

analyzed: saṃjñā karma tu asmad viśiṣṭānām liṅgam
translated: The action of naming is the inferential mark of those superior to us.
Because the action of naming is engaged in perception.

analyzed: niṣkramaṇam praveśanam iti ākāśasya liṅgam  / tat aliṅgam eka dravya tvāt karmaṇaḥ  /
translated: The going out and entering are the inferential mark of space.
That is not an inferential mark because of being a single substance, and because of the difference in the effect of action.
The absence of action is due to the conjunction,

analyzed: kāraṇa guṇa pūrvakaḥ kārya guṇaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: The quality of the effect is seen to be preceded by the quality of the cause.

analyzed: kārya antara aprādurbhāvāt ca śabdaḥ sparśavatām aguṇaḥ
translated: And because of the non-appearance of another effect, sound is not a quality of what has contact.

original: paratra samavāyāt pratyakṣatvācca nātmaguṇo na manoguṇaḥ / / / /
analyzed: paratra samavāyāt pratyakṣa tvāt ca na ātma guṇaḥ na manaḥ guṇaḥ
translated: Because of inherence in another and because of perceptibility, it is not a quality of the self or the mind.
By the remainder, there is an inferential mark of space.

analyzed: dravya tva nitya tve vāyunā vyākhyāte  /
translated: The substantiality and eternality are explained by air.
By the existence of that.

analyzed: śabda aliṅga aviśeṣāt viśeṣa liṅga abhāvāt ca
translated: Because of the non-distinction of sound and the absence of a distinguishing inferential mark.

analyzed: tad anuvidhānāt eka pṛthak tvam ca iti
translated: And because of the subordination to that, there is oneness and separateness.

original: puṣpavastrayoḥ sati sannikarṣe guṇāntarāprādurbhāvo vastre gandhābhāvaliṅgam / / / /
analyzed: puṣpa vastrayoḥ sati sannikarṣe guṇa antara aprādurbhāvaḥ vastre gandha abhāva liṅgam  /
translated: When there is contact between a flower and a cloth, the absence of fragrance in the cloth is the mark indicating the absence of other qualities.
Smell is fixed in earth.

analyzed: etena uṣṇa tā vyākhyātā  tejasaḥ uṣṇa tā
translated: By this, heat is explained.🔽Heat is in fire.
Coldness is in water.

analyzed: aparasmin aparam yugapad ciram kṣipram iti kāla liṅgāni
translated: The marks of time are the other, the other, simultaneously, long, and quick.

analyzed: dravya tva nitya tve vāyunā vyākhyāte  /
translated: The qualities of being a substance and being eternal are explained by air.
By the existence of that.

analyzed: nitya ūṣu abhāvāt anityeṣu bhāvāt kāraṇe kāla ākhyā iti
translated: Because it does not exist in eternal things and exists in non-eternal things, it is called time, the cause.

analyzed: itas idam iti yatas tad diśyam liṅgam
translated: The mark of that which is to be directed is from this to that.

analyzed: dravya tva nitya tve vāyunā vyākhyāte  /
translated: The qualities of being a substance and being eternal are explained by air.
By the existence of that.

original: kāryaviśeṣeṇa nānātvam / / / /🔽ādityasaṃyogāt bhūtapūrvāt bhaviṣyato bhūtācca prācī / / / /
analyzed: kārya viśeṣeṇa nānātvam  āditya saṃyogāt bhūta pūrvāt bhaviṣyataḥ bhūtāt ca prācī  /
translated: Diversity is by specific effects.🔽The east is from the conjunction with the sun, from what was before, from what will be, and from what is.
Similarly, the south, west, and north.
By this, the intermediate directions are explained.

analyzed: sāmānya pratyakṣāt viśeṣa smṛteḥ ca saṃśayaḥ
translated: Doubt is from the perception of the general and the memory of the specific.
And what is seen is like what is seen.
And because of being seen as it is and not as it is...
And doubt is from knowledge and ignorance...

analyzed: śrotra grahaṇaḥ yaḥ ṛthaḥ sa śabdaḥ
translated: The meaning grasped by the ear is sound...

analyzed: tulya jātīyeṣu artha antara bhūteṣu viśeṣasya ubhayathā dṛṣṭa tvāt
translated: Because the particular is seen in both ways among things of the same class that are different...
It is not a substance because it is of one substance...
Nor is it an action because it is not visible...
The liberation of an existing quality is similar to actions...
Because there is no indication of an existing [quality]...🔽Because it is contrary to the eternal...

analyzed: anityaḥ ca ayam kāraṇataḥ  ja ca a siddham vikārāt
translated: And this is impermanent because it arises from a cause...🔽And what is not established is a modification...
In manifestation, because of the fault...

analyzed: saṃyogāt vibhāgāt ca śabdāt ca śabda niṣpattiḥ
translated: Sound arises from conjunction and disjunction, and from sound...
And sound is impermanent because of the mark...
Because there is no activity of the two...
From the first sound...
And because of the state of agreement...
When there is plurality, they are doubtful...
The absence of number is in general...
The sense objects are well-known...

analyzed: indriya artha aprasiddhiḥ indriya arthebhyaḥ ṛtha antarasya hetuḥ
translated: The non-establishment of the sense objects is the reason for something different from the sense objects...
That is non-indication.🔽Due to ignorance of the cause.
Due to knowledge of effects.

analyzed: ajñānāt ca  anyat eva hetuḥ iti anapadeśaḥ
translated: And due to ignorance.🔽The cause is different, therefore it is non-indication.

analyzed: artha antaram hi artha antarasya anapadeśaḥ
translated: For one thing is not an indication of another thing.

analyzed: saṃyogi samavāyi eka artha samavāyi virodhi ca
translated: Conjoined, inhering in the same thing, contradictory, and so on.🔽The effect of another effect.🔽The contradictory is not the cause of what is not a cause.🔽The cause is not the cause of what is not a cause.

analyzed: kāryam kārya antarasya  virodhya bhūtam bhūtasya  bhūtam abhūtasya  / bhūtaḥ bhūtasya
translated: The cause is the cause of what is a cause.
Because indication is preceded by knowledge.
What is unknown, non-indicated, non-existent, and doubtful is non-indication.
Because it has horns, therefore it is a horse.

analyzed: yasmāt viṣāṇī tasmāt gauḥ iti ca anaikāntikasya udāharaṇam
translated: Because it has horns, therefore it is a cow - this is an example of what is inconclusive.

analyzed: ātma indriya artha sannikarṣāt yat niṣpadyate tat anyat
translated: What is produced from the contact of the self, senses, and objects is different from that.

original: pravṛttinivṛttī ca pratyagātmani dṛṣṭe paratra liṅgam / / / /
analyzed: pravṛtti nivṛttī ca pratyagātmani dṛṣṭe paratra liṅgam
translated: And the indication of engagement and disengagement is seen in the self, and in others it is a sign.

analyzed: ātma indriya artha sannikarṣa jñānasya bhāvaḥ bhāvaḥ ca manasaḥ liṅgam
translated: The existence and non-existence of the knowledge of the contact of the self, senses, and objects is a sign of the mind.

analyzed: tasya dravya tva nitya tve vāyunā vyākhyāte  /
translated: Its substantiality and eternality are explained by the wind.

analyzed: prayatna ayaugapadyāt jñāna ayaugapadyāt ca ekam
translated: One, because of the impossibility of simultaneous effort and simultaneous cognition.

analyzed: prāṇa apāna nimeṣa unmeṣa jīvana manaḥ gati indriya antara vikārāḥ sukha duḥkha icchā dveṣa prayatnāḥ ca ātmanaḥ liṅgāni  /
translated: The movements of inhalation and exhalation, winking and opening of eyes, life, mind, the changes in the sense organs, pleasure, pain, desire, aversion, and effort are the signs of the self.

analyzed: tasya dravya tva nitya tve vāyunā vyākhyāte  /
translated: Its substantiality and eternality have been explained by the example of air.

original: yajñadatta iti sannikarṣe pratyakṣābhāvāt dṛṣṭaṃ liṅgaṃ na vidyate / / / /
analyzed: yajñadattaḥ iti sannikarṣe pratyakṣa abhāvāt dṛṣṭam liṅgam na vidyate  /
translated: In the case of Yajnadatta, there is no perception due to proximity, so the observed sign does not exist.
And there is no distinction from the generally perceived.
Therefore, it is based on scripture.

analyzed: aham iti śabdasya vyatirekāt na āgamikam
translated: It is not based on scripture because of the exclusion of the word I.

analyzed: yadi dṛṣṭam anvakṣam aham devadattaḥ ham yajñadattaḥ iti
translated: If the seen is directly perceived, I am Devadatta, I am Yajnadatta.

original: dṛṣṭyātmani liṅge eka eva dṛḍhatvāt pratyakṣavat pratyayaḥ / / / /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi ātmani liṅge ekaḥ eva dṛḍha tvāt pratyakṣa vat pratyayaḥ  /
translated: In the sign of the seen self, there is only one firm cognition, like perception.

analyzed: devadattaḥ gacchati yajñadattaḥ gacchati iti upacārāt śarīre pratyayaḥ  /
translated: The cognition of the body is by convention, as in Devadatta goes, Yajnadatta goes.
But conventions are doubtful.

analyzed: aham iti pratyagātmani bhāvāt paratra abhāvāt artha antara pratyakṣaḥ
translated: The cognition of the self is direct, because of the presence of the word I in the inner self and absence elsewhere.

analyzed: devadattaḥ gacchati iti upacārāt abhimānāt tāvat śarīra pratyakṣaḥ haṅkāraḥ
translated: The notion of I is directly perceived in the body, due to the figurative usage of Devadatta goes based on identification.
The figurative usage is doubtful.

analyzed: na tu śarīra viśeṣāt yajñadatta viṣṇumitrayoḥ jñāna viṣayaḥ
translated: But the body is not the object of knowledge of Yajnadatta and Vishnu Mitra.

analyzed: aham iti mukhya yogyābhyām śabda vat vyatireka avyabhicārāt viśeṣa siddheḥ na āgamikaḥ
translated: The distinction is established by the non-deviation of the principal and suitable words from the exclusion, like the word I. It is not based on scripture.

analyzed: sukha duḥkha jñāna niṣpatti aviśeṣāt aikātmyam
translated: The oneness is due to the non-distinction in the production of pleasure, pain, and knowledge.
The distinction is due to the arrangement.
And also due to the capability of the scriptures.
Like an existent without a cause, it is eternal.
Its effect is the mark.
The absence of effect is due to the absence of the cause.
The absence of the negation is specifically in the form of non-eternal.

analyzed: avidyā  mahati aneka dravyavat tvāt rūpāt ca upalabdhiḥ
translated: Ignorance.🔽The perception is due to being large and having many substances, and also due to form.

analyzed: sati api dravya tve mahat tve rūpa saṃskāra abhāvāt vāyoḥ anupalabdhiḥ
translated: Even though it is a substance, the air is not perceived due to the absence of largeness and the modification of form.

analyzed: aneka dravya samavāyāt rūpa viśeṣāt ca rūpa upalabdhiḥ
translated: The perception of form is due to the inherence in many substances and also due to the specific form.

analyzed: tena rasa gandha sparśeṣu jñānam vyākhyātam  /
translated: By that, the knowledge of taste, smell, and touch is explained.
Because of the absence of that, there is non-deviation.

original: saṃkhyāḥ parimāṇāni pṛthaktvaṃ saṃyoga vibhāgau paratvāparatve karma ca rūpadravyasamavāyāt cākṣuṣāṇi / / / /
analyzed: saṃkhyāḥ parimāṇāni pṛthaktvam saṃyoga vibhāgau paratva aparatve karma ca rūpa dravya samavāyāt cākṣuṣāṇi  /
translated: Numbers, dimensions, separateness, conjunction, disjunction, priority, posteriority, and action are visible due to inherence in color and substance.
In the formless, they are not visible.

original: etena guṇatve bhāve ca sarvendriyaṃ jñānaṃ vyākhyātam / / / /
analyzed: etena guṇa tve bhāve ca sarva indriyam jñānam vyākhyātam
translated: By this, the knowledge of all senses in the case of qualities and existence is explained.

analyzed: tat punar pṛthivī ādi kārya dravyam trividham śarīra indriya viṣaya saṃjñakam
translated: That, again, the effect substance such as earth, etc., is of three kinds, called body, sense organ, and object.

analyzed: pratyakṣa apratyakṣāṇām saṃyogasya apratyakṣa tvāt pañca ātmakam na vidyate
translated: Since the conjunction of the perceptible and imperceptible is imperceptible, the five-fold [atom] does not exist.

analyzed: guṇa antara aprādurbhāvāt ca na tri ātmakam
translated: And since another quality does not appear, it is not three-fold.
But the conjunction with the atom is not denied.

analyzed: tatra śarīram dvividham yoni jam ayonijam ca
translated: There, the body is of two kinds: born from a womb and not born from a womb.

analyzed: aniyata diś deśa pūrvaka tvāt  dharma viśeṣāt ca
translated: Because of the prior existence of an indefinite direction and place.🔽And because of a particular quality.
And because of the absence of a common name.
Because the name is primary.
There are those not born from a womb.

analyzed: veda liṅgāt ca  ātma saṃyoga prayatnābhyām haste karma  /
translated: And because of the indication of the Vedas.🔽Action in the hand is due to the conjunction of the self and effort.

analyzed: tathā hasta saṃyogāt ca musale karma
translated: Similarly, action in the pestle is due to the conjunction with the hand.

analyzed: abhighāta je musala ādau karmaṇi vyatirekāt akāraṇam hasta saṃyogaḥ
translated: In the case of an effect produced by impact, such as a blow from a hammer, the contact of the hand is not the cause, as it is absent when the effect is absent.
Similarly, the contact of the self is not the cause of the action of the hand.
The action in the hand is produced by the contact of the hammer due to the impact.
The action of the self is produced by the contact of the hand.
In the absence of contact, there is falling due to gravity.

analyzed: nodana viśeṣa abhāvāt na ūrdhvam na tiryaggamanam  prayatna viśeṣāt nodana viśeṣaḥ
translated: There is no upward or horizontal motion due to the absence of a special impulsion.🔽A special impulsion is produced by a special effort.
A special action is produced by a special impulsion.
The action of the child is explained by the action of the hand.

analyzed: tathā dagdhasya visphoṭane  / yatna abhāve prasuptasya calanam
translated: Similarly, in the bursting of what is burnt.🔽The motion of one who is asleep is due to the absence of effort.
The action in grass is due to the contact with air.

analyzed: maṇi gamanam sūci abhisarpaṇam adṛṣṭa kāraṇam  iṣau ayugapad saṃyoga viśeṣāḥ karma anya tve hetuḥ
translated: The motion of a gem and the penetration of a needle are due to unseen causes.🔽The special contacts of an arrow simultaneously are the cause of the difference in action.

original: nodanādādyamiṣoḥ karma tatkarmakāritācca saṃskārāduttaraṃ tathottaramuttaraṃ ca / / / /
analyzed: nodanāt ādyam iṣoḥ karma tad karma kāritāt ca saṃskārāt uttaram tathā uttaram uttaram ca  /
translated: The first action of the arrow is due to impulsion, and the subsequent ones are due to the impressions produced by that action.
In the absence of impressions, there is falling due to gravity.

analyzed: nodana abhighātāt saṃyukta saṃyogāt ca pṛthivyām karma
translated: Action in earth is due to impulsion and collision of conjoined things.
It is caused by unseen force, due to its specific nature.

analyzed: apām saṃyoga abhāve guru tvāt patanam
translated: In water, sinking is due to gravity in the absence of cohesion.
Flowing is due to fluidity.
Rising is due to the conjunction of air through a tube.
It is due to impulsion and compression of conjoined things.
The creeping of plants is caused by unseen force.

original: apāṃ saṅghāto vilayanaṃ ca tejaḥ saṃyogāt / / / /
analyzed: apām saṅghātaḥ vilayanam ca tejaḥ saṃyogāt
translated: The cohesion and melting of water is due to the conjunction with fire.
The lightning is the sign there.
And it is Vedic.
Of the thunder, it is due to the conjunction and disjunction of water.

original: pṛthivīkarmaṇā tejaḥ karma vāyukarma ca vyākhyātam / / / /
analyzed: pṛthivī karmaṇā tejaḥ karma vāyu karma ca vyākhyātam
translated: The action of fire and air has been explained by the action of earth.

analyzed: agneḥ ūrdhva jvalanam vāyoḥ tiryak gamanam aṇūnām manasaḥ ca ādyam karma adṛṣṭa kāritam  /
translated: The upward burning of fire, the horizontal movement of air, and the initial action of atoms and mind are caused by unseen force.

original: hastakarmaṇā manasaḥ karma vyākhyātam / / / /🔽ātmendriyamanor'thasannikarṣāt sukha duḥkhe / / / /
analyzed: hasta karmaṇā manasaḥ karma vyākhyātam  / ātma indriya manaḥ rtha sannikarṣāt sukha duḥkhe
translated: The action of mind has been explained by the action of the hand.🔽Pleasure and pain arise from the contact of soul, sense organs, mind and objects.

original: tadanārambha ātmasthe manasi śarīrasya duḥkhābhāvaḥ saṃyogaḥ / / / /
analyzed: tad anārambhe ātma sthe manasi śarīrasya duḥkha abhāvaḥ saṃyogaḥ
translated: The absence of that, i.e., the absence of pain in the body when the mind is in the soul, is conjunction.

analyzed: apasarpaṇam upasarpaṇam aśita pīta saṃyogāḥ kārya antara saṃyogāḥ ca iti adṛṣṭa kāritāni  /
translated: Moving away, moving towards, conjunction with food and drink, and conjunction with other actions are caused by the unseen force.
In the absence of that, the absence of conjunction and non-appearance is liberation.

analyzed: dravya guṇa karma niṣpatti vaidharmyāt abhāvaḥ tamaḥ
translated: Absence is darkness due to the difference in the production of substance, quality and action.
And because light is obstructed by another substance.

analyzed: diś kālau ākāśam ca kriyāvat vaidharmyāt niṣkriyāṇi
translated: Space and time are inactive due to the difference in action with space and time.
By this, actions and qualities are explained.
The conjunction of the inactive is prohibited by actions.
But the qualities that are not in conjunction are the cause.
Space is explained by qualities.
Time is by the cause.
In the Veda, the creation of speech is preceded by intelligence.
In the Brahmana, the sign of success is the nominal action.
Giving is preceded by intelligence.
Similarly, receiving.

analyzed: ātma antara guṇānām ātma antare kāraṇa tvāt  /
translated: Because the qualities of one self are not the cause in another self.

analyzed: tat duṣṭa bhojane na vidyate  / duṣṭam hiṃsāyām
translated: It does not exist in eating the impure.🔽Impure means violence.
The fault is from the utterance of that.

original: tadaduṣṭe na vidyate / / / /🔽punarviśiṣṭe pravṛttiḥ / / / /🔽same hīne vā pravṛttiḥ / / / /🔽etena hīnasamaviśiṣṭa dhārmikebhyaḥ parasvādānaṃ vyākhyātam / / / /🔽tathā viruddhānāṃ tyāgaḥ / / / /🔽hīne pare tyāgaḥ / / / /🔽same ātmatyāgaḥ paratyāgo vā / / / /🔽viśiṣṭe ātmatyāga iti / / / /🔽dṛṣṭādṛṣṭa prayojanānāṃ dṛṣṭābhāve prayojanamabhyudayāya / / / /🔽abhiṣecanopavāsa brahmacaryagurukulavāsavānaprastha yajñadāna prokṣaṇadiṅnakṣatramantrakālaniyamāścādṛṣṭāya / / / /🔽cāturāśramyamupadhā anupadhāśca / / / /🔽bhāvadoṣa upadhādoṣo 'nupadhā / / / /
analyzed: tat aduṣṭe na vidyate  / punar viśiṣṭe pravṛttiḥ  same hīne vā pravṛttiḥ  etena hīna sama viśiṣṭa dhārmikebhyaḥ para sva ādānam vyākhyātam  tathā viruddhānām tyāgaḥ  hīne pare tyāgaḥ  same ātma tyāgaḥ para tyāgaḥ vā  viśiṣṭe ātmatyāgaḥ iti  dṛṣṭa adṛṣṭa prayojanānām dṛṣṭa abhāve prayojanam abhyudayāya  abhiṣecana upavāsa brahmacarya guru kula vāsa vānaprastha yajña dāna prokṣaṇa diś nakṣatra mantra kāla niyamāḥ ca a dṛṣṭāya  cāturāśramyam upadhāḥ anupadhāḥ ca  bhāva doṣaḥ upadhā doṣaḥ nupadhā
translated: That is not found in the faultless.

original: yadiṣṭarūparasagandhasparśaṃ prokṣitamabhyukṣitaṃ ca tacchuci / / / /🔽aśucīti śucipratiṣedhaḥ / / / /🔽arthāntaraṃ ca / / / /
analyzed: yat iṣṭa rūpa rasa gandha sparśam prokṣitam abhyukṣitam ca tat śuci 🔽aśuci iti śuci pratiṣedhaḥ 🔽artha antaram ca
translated: If it has the desired form, taste, smell, and touch, if it is sprinkled and drenched, it is pure.🔽The prohibition of purity is impure.🔽And it is a different meaning. . . .🔽🔽

original: ayatasya śucibhojanādabhyudayo na vidyate niyamābhāvād vidyate vār'thāntaratvād yamasya / / / /
analyzed: a yatasya śuci bhojanāt abhyudayaḥ na vidyate niyama abhāvāt vidyate vā artha antara tvāt yamasya
translated: There is no prosperity for one who is not disciplined, due to lack of control, but there is prosperity for one who is disciplined, due to the difference in the object of restraint.
And because there is no non-existence when there is existence.
Attachment arises from pleasure.
And because of being full of that.
And because of the unseen.
And because of the particular caste.

analyzed: icchā dveṣa pūrvikā dharma adharma pravṛttiḥ
translated: The engagement in virtue and vice is preceded by desire and aversion.
The conjunction and disjunction of that.
The liberation in the self and actions has been explained.
The qualities have been stated.

analyzed: pṛthivī ādi rūpa rasa gandha sparśāḥ dravya anitya tvāt anityāḥ ca
translated: Earth etc. have form, taste, smell and touch, and are impermanent due to the impermanence of substances.
By this, the permanence in the permanent ones has been stated.

original: apsu tejasi vāyau ca nityā dravyanityavāt / / / /
analyzed: apsu tejasi vāyau ca nityāḥ dravya nitya vāt
translated: In water, fire and air, they are permanent due to the permanence of substances.
In the impermanent ones, they are impermanent due to the impermanence of substances.

analyzed: kāraṇa guṇa pūrvakāḥ pṛthivyām pāka jāḥ
translated: In earth, the products of cooking are preceded by the qualities of the cause.
Because of being of one substance.

analyzed: aṇoḥ mahataḥ ca upalabdhi anupalabdhī nitye vyākhyāte  /
translated: The perception and non-perception of the atom and the large have been explained in the permanent ones.
And because of the plurality of causes.
The opposite of that is the atom.

analyzed: aṇu mahat iti tasmin viśeṣa bhāvāt viśeṣa abhāvāt ca
translated: The atom and the large are so because of the presence of difference in that and the absence of difference.
Because of being of the same time.

original: dṛṣṭāntācca / / / /🔽aṇutvamahattvayoraṇutvamahattvābhāvaḥ karmaguṇairvyākhyātaḥ / / / /🔽karmabhiḥ karmāṇi guṇaiśca guṇā vyākhyātāḥ / / / /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāntāt ca  aṇu tva mahā tvayoḥ aṇu tva mahā tva abhāvaḥ karma guṇaiḥ vyākhyātaḥ  karmabhiḥ karmāṇi guṇaiḥ ca guṇāḥ vyākhyātāḥ
translated: And from the example...🔽Atomicity and largeness are explained by atomicity and largeness being absent in atoms and large things respectively.🔽Actions are explained by actions, and qualities by qualities.

analyzed: aṇu tva mahā tvābhyām karma guṇāḥ ca vyākhyātāḥ
translated: Actions and qualities are explained by atomicity and largeness.

analyzed: etena dīrgha tva hrasva tve vyākhyāte  anitye nityam
translated: Length and shortness are explained by this.
The impermanent is explained by the impermanent.🔽The permanent is explained by the permanent.
The permanent is circular.
Ignorance is a mark of knowledge.

analyzed: vibhavāt mahān ākāśaḥ tathā ca ātmā
translated: The great space is from the dissolution of the elements, and so is the self.
The mind is atomic due to the absence of that.
The directions are explained by the qualities.
Time is by the cause.

analyzed: rupa rasa gandha sparśa vyatirekāt artha antaram eka tvam
translated: Unity is a different object from color, taste, smell, and touch.
Plurality is similar.

analyzed: ekatva ekapṛthaktvayoḥ ekatva ekapṛthaktva abhāvaḥ ṇu tva mahā tvābhyām vyākhyātaḥ
translated: The absence of unity and plurality of unity and plurality is explained by atomicity and largeness.

original: niḥ saṃkhyatvāt karmaguṇānāṃ sarvaikatvaṃ na vidyate / / / /
analyzed: niḥ saṃkhya tvāt karma guṇānām sarva eka tvam na vidyate  /
translated: Due to the innumerable number of actions and qualities, there is no unity of all.
That is a mistake.

analyzed: eka tva abhāvāt bhaktiḥ tu na vidyate
translated: Due to the absence of unity, there is no devotion.

analyzed: kārya kāraṇayoḥ ekatva ekapṛthaktva abhāvāt ekatva ekapṛthaktvam na vidyate  /
translated: Because there is no identity or separateness of cause and effect, identity and separateness do not exist.
The explanation of these two impermanent ones is given.

analyzed: anyatara karma jaḥ ubha karma jaḥ saṃyoga jaḥ ca saṃyogaḥ
translated: Conjunction is produced by the action of one, by the action of both, and by conjunction.
By this, disjunction is explained.

analyzed: saṃyoga vibhāgayoḥ saṃyoga vibhāga abhāvaḥ aṇu tva mahā tvābhyām vyākhyātaḥ
translated: The absence of conjunction and disjunction of conjunction and disjunction is explained by minuteness and largeness.

analyzed: karmabhiḥ karmāṇi guṇaiḥ guṇāḥ aṇu tva mahā tvābhyām iti
translated: By actions, actions; by qualities, qualities; by minuteness and largeness.

analyzed: yuta siddhi abhāvāt kārya kāraṇayoḥ saṃyoga vibhāgau na vidyete  /
translated: Because of the absence of the property of being simultaneously produced, conjunction and disjunction do not exist between cause and effect.
Because of being a quality.
A quality is also manifested.
Because of being inactive.

analyzed: asati na asti iti ca prayogāt
translated: Because of the usage when there is no, it does not exist.
The relation between word and meaning is not established.
From the conjoined stick and from the inhering particular.
The cognition of meaning from a word is conventional.

analyzed: eka dikkābhyām eka kālābhyām sannikṛṣṭa viprakṛṣṭābhyām param aparam ca
translated: From those in one direction, from those in one time, from those in close proximity, from those at a distance, and from the supreme and the inferior.
Because of being the supreme cause and because of being the non-supreme cause.

analyzed: paratva aparatvayoḥ paratva aparatva abhāvaḥ ṇu tva mahā tvābhyām vyākhyātaḥ
translated: The absence of priority and posteriority in priority and posteriority is explained by minuteness and largeness.
By actions, actions are explained.
By qualities, qualities are explained.

analyzed: iha idam iti yatas kārya kāraṇayoḥ sa samavāyaḥ  /
translated: Where there is this and that, that inherence is of the cause and effect.
By the truth of existence.
Knowledge in substances has been explained.
There, the self and mind are imperceptible.
In the teaching of knowledge, the injunction for the accomplishment of knowledge is stated.

analyzed: guṇa karmasu sannikṛṣṭeṣu jñāna niṣpatteḥ dravyam kāraṇam  /
translated: Because of the accomplishment of knowledge in substances that are in contact with qualities and actions, substance is the cause.

analyzed: sāmānya viśeṣeṣu sāmānya viśeṣa abhāvāt tat eva jñānam  sāmānya viśeṣa apekṣam dravya guṇa karmasu
translated: In universals and particulars, because there are no universals and particulars, that very knowledge.🔽Depending on universals and particulars, in substances, qualities and actions.
In a substance, depending on substance, quality and action.

analyzed: guṇa karmasu guṇa karma abhāvāt guṇa karma apekṣam na vidyate
translated: In qualities and actions, because there are no qualities and actions, there is no dependence on qualities and actions.

original: samavāyinaḥ śvaityācchvaitya buddheśca śvete budviste ete kāryakāraṇabhūte / / / /
analyzed: samavāyinaḥ śvaityāt śvaitya buddheḥ ca śvete budviḥ te ete kārya kāraṇa bhūte
translated: The inhering white color and the cognition of whiteness in the white object, these two are cause and effect.
In substances, they are not mutually causes.

original: kāraṇāyaugapadyāt kāraṇakramācca ghaṭapaṭādibuddhīnāṃ kramo na hetuphalabhāvāt / / / /
analyzed: kāraṇa ayaugapadyāt kāraṇa kramāt ca ghaṭa paṭa ādi buddhīnām kramaḥ na hetu phala bhāvāt
translated: The order of the cognitions of pot, cloth, etc. is due to the order of their causes, not to the relation of cause and effect.

original: ayameṣa tvayā kṛtaṃ bhojayainaṃ iti buddhyapekṣam / / / /
analyzed: ayam eṣa tvayā kṛtam bhojaya enam iti buddhi apekṣam
translated: This is to be eaten by you, this is to be given to him, etc. are dependent on the cognitions.
Because of the existence in the seen, and non-existence in the unseen.
The meaning is in substances, qualities and actions.

original: dravyeṣu pañcātmakatvaṃ pratiṣiddham / / / /🔽bhūyastvāt gandhavattvācca pṛthivī gandhajñāne prakṛtiḥ / / / /
analyzed: dravyeṣu pañca ātmaka tvam pratiṣiddham  bhūyaḥ tvāt gandhavat tvāt ca pṛthivī gandha jñāne prakṛtiḥ
translated: The five-fold nature of substances is refuted.🔽Earth is the cause of the cognition of smell due to the predominance of smell.

analyzed: tathā āpaḥ tejaḥ vāyuḥ ca rasa rūpa sparśa aviśeṣāt
translated: Similarly, water, fire and air are the causes of the cognition of taste, color and touch respectively due to the absence of distinction in taste, color and touch.

analyzed: kriyā guṇa vyapadeśa abhāvāt prāk asat
translated: It is non-existent before due to the absence of action and quality designation.
It is existent and non-existent.

analyzed: asataḥ kriyā guṇa vyapadeśa abhāvāt artha antaram
translated: The other is different from the non-existent due to the absence of action and quality designation of the non-existent.
It is existent and non-existent.

analyzed: yat ca anyat asat atas tat asat  /
translated: And what is other than the non-existent is non-existent.

analyzed: asat iti bhūta pratyakṣa abhāvāt bhūta smṛteḥ virodhi pratyakṣa vat
translated: Non-existent is due to the absence of direct perception of the elements, and the contradiction of the memory of the elements is like direct perception.
Similarly, due to the direct perception of existence in that state.

analyzed: etena a ghaṭaḥ gauḥ adharmaḥ ca vyākhyātāḥ
translated: By this, the non-pot, the non-cow and the quality are explained.
The non-existent is not different from non-existence.

original: nāsti ghaṭo gehe iti sato ghaṭasya gehasaṃsargapratiṣedhaḥ / / / /
analyzed: na asti ghaṭaḥ gehe iti sataḥ ghaṭasya geha saṃsarga pratiṣedhaḥ
translated: The negation of the existence of a pot in a house is the denial of the connection of an existent pot with the house. .

analyzed: ātmani ātma manasoḥ saṃyogāt ātma pratyakṣam
translated: The perception of the self is due to the contact of the self and the mind in the self.
Similarly, there is perception of other substances.

analyzed: asamāhita antar karaṇāḥ upasaṃhṛta samādhayaḥ teṣām ca
translated: For those whose internal organs are not concentrated, whose concentration is withdrawn, and for them.
Due to the inherence of that, in the qualities of action.
Due to the inherence of the self, in the qualities of the self.

original: asyedaṃ kāryaṃ kāraṇaṃ saṃyogi virodhi samavāyi ceti laiṅgikam / / / /
analyzed: asya idam kāryam kāraṇam saṃyogi virodhi samavāyi ca iti laiṅgikam
translated: This is the effect, cause, conjoined, opposed, and inhering of that, which is inferred.

analyzed: asya idam kārya kāraṇa sambandhaḥ ca avayavāt bhavati
translated: And the relation of this with the effect and cause is due to the part.
By this, the verbal [means of knowledge] is explained.

analyzed: hetuḥ apadeśaḥ liṅgam pramāṇam karaṇam iti anarthāntaram
translated: Cause, indication, mark, means of knowledge, instrument - these are not different.

analyzed: asya idam iti buddhi apekṣita tvāt
translated: Because it is required by the cognition of 'this is of that'.

analyzed: ātmanaḥ saṃyoga viśeṣāt saṃskārāt ca smṛtiḥ
translated: Memory is due to a particular contact of the self and impressions.
Similarly, dream.
The end of dream.
And from dharma.

analyzed: indriya doṣāt saṃskāra doṣāt ca avidyā  tat duṣṭa jñānam
translated: Ignorance is due to the fault of the senses and the fault of impressions.🔽That is false knowledge.
Non-false is knowledge.
And the knowledge of the Siddhas is from the scriptures.

analyzed: iṣṭa aniṣṭa kāraṇa viśeṣāt virodhāt ca mithas sukha duḥkhayoḥ artha antara bhāvaḥ  / saṃśaya nirṇaya antara abhāvaḥ ca jñāna antara tve hetuḥ
translated: And the difference between pleasure and pain is due to the difference in the causes of what is desired and what is not desired, and to their mutual contradiction.🔽And the absence of any other knowledge is the reason for the absence of doubt and certainty in the case of a different knowledge.
And their production is by perception and inference.

analyzed: abhūt iti api  sati ca kārya adarśanāt
translated: And it is said to have been.🔽And in the case of the non-appearance of the effect,

analyzed: eka artha samavāyi kāraṇa antareṣu dṛṣṭa tvāt
translated: because it is seen in other causes that are conjoined with the same object.

original: ekadeśe ityekasmin śiraḥ pṛṣṭhamudaraṃ marmāṇi tadviśeṣastadviśeṣebhyaḥ / / / /
analyzed: eka deśe iti ekasmin śiraḥ pṛṣṭham udaram marmāṇi tad viśeṣaḥ tad viśeṣebhyaḥ
translated: In one part, in one head, back, belly, vital parts, and their specificities, from those specificities.
The cause, because of the inherence of the effect in the substance.
Or from conjunction.
The actions are from the inherence in the cause.

analyzed: tathā rūpe kāraṇa eka artha samavāyāt ca
translated: Similarly, from the inherence of the cause in the same object in color.
The conjunction of the cloth is from the inherence of the cause.
And from the inherence of the cause and non-cause.
And from the inherence of the conjoined, the specific of fire.

analyzed: dṛṣṭānām dṛṣṭa prayojanānām dṛṣṭa abhāve prayogaḥ bhyudayāya
translated: The application of what is seen, for the sake of what is seen, is for prosperity, in the absence of what is seen.
The validity of the Veda is from its statement.
